review_title: When work is just as great as home :)
job_title: Direct Support Professional in Jefferson, WI
pros:
This is a great work environment for those that seek to have more autonomy in their career. Management is readily available to support their clients and staff, but don't micromanage every aspect of the job (Which I have personally found to be helpful in fostering creativity among staff, as well as comfort for clients). They compensate their employees significantly above what the market rate is paying. Along with a higher base pay, they have a great benefits package for full-time, and when it applies; part-time employees. These benefits include; health insurance plans (with optional FSA), dental, vision, 401(k) retirement (with employer match!), PTO, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, EAP, and both short and long term disability.
St. Coletta provides exceptional classroom and on-the-job training that equips their staff (even those who may be inexperienced) with the knowledge, skills, and confidence to be successful. Another pro that I have personally found to be one of St. Coletta’s biggest, is the variety of shifts/positions available (1st, 2nd, and 3rd shifts). They offer full-time, part-time, and substitute status positions that allow for plenty of flexibility. Weekend or overnight asleep positions are great options available for college students like me who have complex schedules. There is also plenty of opportunity for promotion and advancement.
The biggest pro (after almost five years of employment) is the family-oriented atmosphere that St. Coletta creates. Starting with the visual of the client’s homes, all the way down to daily interactions and activities offered, St. Coletta screams family. Staff support clients, clients support staff, and clients support each other. Whether it be cheering each other on at Special Olympics or enjoying a holiday feast together, unity and passion are at the forefront. Coworkers compliment and build off of each other’s strengths and weaknesses vs. trying to criticize and tear one another down. Because of this dynamic and culture, when obstacles arise; they can be worked through and resolved as a team. St. Coletta is a place that both clients and staff can call home.
cons: Sometimes there can be shortages of staff, but this leaves employees with opportunities to work extra hours and add some extra money to their wallets.
